Issues.Title: perf(core): simplify bloom bucket computation
Issues.Body:
The injector system uses a bloom filter to determine if a token is
possibly defined in the node injector tree, which is stored across
multiple bloom buckets that each represent 32 bits of the full 256-bit
wide bloom hash. This means that a computation is required to determine
the exact bloom bucket which is responsible for storing any given 32-bit
interval, which was previously computed using three bitmask operations
and three branches to derive the bloom bucket offset.

This commit exploits the observation that all bits beyond the low 5 bits
of the bloom hash are an accurate representation for the bucket offset,
if shifted right such that those bits become the least significant bits.
This reduces the three bitmask operations and three branches with a
single shift operation, while additionally offering a code size
improvement.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(core): simplify bloom bucket computation" (#40489)

Issues.Title: refactor(language-service): do not mutate the original template node â€¦
Issues.Body:
â€¦span

Rather than mutating the span on the template when renaming literal strings,
this commit updates the logic to mutate the `TextSpan` equivalent that
is used by the Language Service.

Issues.Title: WIP(core): Allow Trusted Types values to bypass sanitization
Issues.Body:
Trusted Types values can be considered safe to inject directly into DOM
sinks, as they can only be produced from Trusted Types security
policies.

Issues.Title: Angular repo packages incompatibilities with Apple M1 ARM64 processor
Issues.Body:
# ğŸš€ feature request
Update some packages versions to be able to work on Angular repo locally on new Apple M1 machines.

### Relevant Package
angular:dev-infra


### Description
Some packages do not work properly on Apple M1 machine.

### Prerequisites
1. Modify node version fixed at 13.0.0 maximum in package.json to at least 15.3 as nodejs started running natively on M1 machines with this version.

```
yarn
yarn install v1.22.5
$ node tools/yarn/check-yarn.js

error angular-srcs@11.2.0-next.0: The engine "node" is incompatible with this module. Expected version ">=10.9.0 <13.0.0". Got "15.6.0"
error Found incompatible module.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/install for documentation about this command.
```


2.  Update bazelisk to at least 1.6.0 version in which arm64 is supproted as you can see here https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazelisk/releases/tag/v1.6.0.

When I try to run `yarn bazel test //packages/...`, I get:
```

yarn run v1.22.5
$ /Users/anasbarghoud/WebstormProjects/angular/node_modules/.bin/bazel test //packages/...
FATAL: Your platform/architecture combination darwin - arm64 is not yet supported.
    You may need to compile Bazelisk yourself, or use the Python version.
    See instructions at https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazelisk/blob/master/README.md.
node:internal/validators:129
    throw new ERR_INVALID_ARG_TYPE(name, 'string', value);
    ^

TypeError [ERR_INVALID_ARG_TYPE]: The "file" argument must be of type string. Received an instance of Promise
    at new NodeError (node:internal/errors:329:5)
    at validateString (node:internal/validators:129:11)
    at normalizeSpawnArguments (node:child_process:455:3)

  code: 'ERR_INVALID_ARG_TYPE'
}

```

3. Update puppeteer to a version that supports arm64.

Once node maximum version modified, running yarn install causing the following error when trying to run `node install.js`:

```
...

[5/5] ğŸ”¨  Building fresh packages...
[1/17] â  fsevents
[13/17] â  protobufjs
[10/17] â  puppeteer
[14/17] â  spawn-sync
error /Users/anasbarghoud/WebstormProjects/angular/node_modules/puppeteer: Command failed.
Exit code: 1
Command: node install.js
Arguments: 
Directory: /Users/anasbarghoud/WebstormProjects/angular/node_modules/puppeteer
Output:
The chromium binary is not available for arm64: 
If you are on Ubuntu, you can install with: 

 apt-get install chromium-browser

/Users/anasbarghoud/WebstormProjects/angular/node_modules/puppeteer/lib/cjs/puppeteer/node/BrowserFetcher.js:112
            throw new Error();
            ^
```

I don't know if there are more things to do, the points above are what I identified when I tried to execute some yarn commands.

Issues.Title: fix(language-service): Paths on Windows should be normalized
Issues.Body:
Many `ts.LanguageService` APIs accept a filename, for example
```ts
getQuickInfoAtPosition(fileName: string, position: number)
```
The requirement is that `fileName` is agnostic to the platform (Linux, Mac,
Windows, etc), and is always normalized to TypeScript's internal
`NormalizedPath`.

This is evident from the way these APIs are called from the language server:
```ts
  private onHover(params: lsp.TextDocumentPositionParams) {
    const lsInfo = this.getLSAndScriptInfo(params.textDocument);
    if (lsInfo === undefined) {
      return;
    }
    const {languageService, scriptInfo} = lsInfo;
    const offset = lspPositionToTsPosition(scriptInfo, params.position);
    const info = languageService.getQuickInfoAtPosition(scriptInfo.fileName, offset);
    // ...
  }
```
https://github.com/angular/vscode-ng-language-service/blob/9fca9c66510974c26d5c21b31adb9fa39ac0a38a/server/src/session.ts#L594
Here `scriptInfo.fileName` is always a `ts.server.NormalizedPath`.

However, https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/39917 accidentally leaked
the platform-specific paths, and caused a mismatch between the incoming paths
and the paths stored in the internal data structure `TypeScriptServiceHost.fileToComponent`.

This PR fixes the bug by always normalizing the paths, and updating the
type to reflect the format of the underlying data.

Fixes https://github.com/angular/vscode-ng-language-service/issues/1063

Issues.Title: fix(compiler): support multiple `:host-context()` selectors
Issues.Body:
In `ViewEncapsulation.Emulated` mode, the compiler must generate additional
combinations of selectors to handle the `:host-context()` pseudo-class function.

Previously, when there is was than one `:host-context()` selector in a rule,
the compiler was generating invalid selectors.

This commit generates all possible combinations of selectors needed to
match the same elements as the native `:host-context()` selector.

Fixes #19199
Supercedes #21256
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(compiler): support multiple `:host-context()` selectors" (#40494)

Issues.Title: [NgTemplateOutlet] _updateExistingContext causes side effects
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/common ### Is this a regression? I don't know, but I'm sure it occurs also in version 9. ### Description 1. Prepare a template that has an object passed by $implicit (cannot be a primitive value). 2. Change 2 times context value of ngTemplateOutlet. 3. After second change origin object was changed. ## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-fvm7oz?file=src/app/app.component.html 1. Select 0. 2. Inspect selected item - has changed. 3. Select 1. 4. Inspect selected item - has changed. 5. Inspect contents of contexts array - value at index 0 was replaced with value at index 1. 6. Select 0. 7. Inspect selected item - has not changed. ## ğŸ”¥ Exception or Error No error is presented, but if objects inside contexts array are freezed (uncomment line 28 and 31) error is shown: 

ERROR TypeError: Cannot assign to read only property '$implicit' of object '[object Object]'
    at NgTemplateOutlet._updateExistingContext (ng_template_outlet.ts:104)
    at NgTemplateOutlet.ngOnChanges (ng_template_outlet.ts:68)
    at checkAndUpdateDirectiveInline (provider.ts:213)
    at checkAndUpdateNodeInline (view.ts:440)
    at checkAndUpdateNode (view.ts:400)
    at debugCheckAndUpdateNode (services.ts:435)
    at debugCheckDirectivesFn (services.ts:396)
    at Object.eval [as updateDirectives] (AppComponent.html:6)
    at Object.debugUpdateDirectives [as updateDirectives] (services.ts:390)
    at checkAndUpdateView (view.ts:370)
## ğŸŒ Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

11.0.8
**Anything else relevant?** The reason why I use an object in $implicit is that I don't know the structure of object - it's created dynamically. Therefore I cannot separate properties through additional properties.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NgTemplateOutlet] _updateExistingContext causes side effects " (#40493)

Issues.Body:

# ğŸ bug report

### Affected Package
tested on ~ 10, 11


### Is this a regression?
not sure 


### Description

```TSX
import { Component, OnInit } from "@angular/core";

@Component({
  selector: "app-dummy-component",
  template: `
    <ng-template>
      <ng-content></ng-content>
    </ng-template>
  `
})
export class DummyComponentComponent implements OnInit {
  constructor() {}

  ngOnInit() {}
}

```
and if the usage is like this

```HTML
<app-dummy-component>

	<app-dummy-child></app-dummy-child>

</app-dummy-component>
```
given this code where there is no place to render ng-template, still, the `app-dummy-child` is being instantiated. this can cause redundant API call when the content isn't rendered yet or wait for some user interaction. we can see that `app-dummy-child` is instantiated and also its `ngOnInit` method is being called. 

any workaround method is welcomed 

## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-juzx3b?file=src/app/dummy-component/dummy-component.component.ts

## ğŸ”¥ Exception or Error

ngOnInit on child items is being called. 


## ğŸŒ  Your Environment

Issues.Title: refactor(zone.js): refactor zone rollup config
Issues.Body:
When migrating zone.js from gulp to bazel, some legacy build config files are still there,
we have `rollup-es5.config.js` and `rollup-es5_global-es2015.config.js`, since in gulp build
system, build `es5` or `esm` files are set in the config file, but in the bazel world,
the output format is not config in the config.js file, but is required by the downstream
bazel target. So we don't really need the two rollup config files any longer.

Another difference is in `rollup-es5.config.js`, the `external` and `global` libraries names
are also config there, and these settings are also valid for `es2015` build, these settings
are not in the `es2015.config.js` for some legacy reasons. So we don't need to keep this
differences either.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(zone.js): refactor zone rollup config" (#40481)

# ğŸš€ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- âœï¸edit: --> This feature request is for @angular/router


### Description
Could you please use `UrlHandlingStrategy` from DI in Router. 
This will allow to prepend language to all `routerLink` and direct `navigate`, `navigateByUrl` calls.
So, all l10n packages will be able to avoid unmet `localize` pipes

it's already defined in providers, but directly declared as property in Router:
https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/4e8198d60f421ce120e3a6b57afe60a9332d2692/packages/router/src/router.ts#L440

### Describe the solution you'd like
Just move `UrlHandlingStrategy` from here property:
https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/4e8198d60f421ce120e3a6b57afe60a9332d2692/packages/router/src/router.ts#L440
to constructor:
https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/4e8198d60f421ce120e3a6b57afe60a9332d2692/packages/router/src/router.ts#L484



### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- âœï¸--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?

Issues.Title: i18n: Order of trans-units in source.xlf seems random
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ bug report

Note: i'm not sure if this is a feature request or a bug report, altough it does feel like buggy behavior.

### Affected Package
The issue is likely caused by package @angular/localize

### Is this a regression?
Not sure, i believe it got worse with v. 11.0 but i cannot exactly pinpoint a specific version.

### Description

In a fairly big project with a lot of different development environments (Mac, Windows, Linux), it is close to impossible to efficiently work with i18n. The main problem we are facing is that many engineers touch the translation files in parallel merge requests. Since Angular 11, it has worsened so far that the diffs are at 1k lines+ for every change in translations, even if just a single translation was added. This has two reasons:

a) the line numbers fluctuate between windows and linux, and likely even on the same OS but on different machines
b) the messages appear to be sorted randomly, which cannot be automatically merged by git

point b) seems to be way worse, as the line numbers changing can easily be resolved by just accepting either one, altough it is quite a pain if you have some thousands of translations.

## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction
not possible to setup, you'd need at least two different systems, and you do need to make code changes for the order to change. 

These are changes made by i18n, altough i only added ONE actually new `trans-unit`, with the previous i18n run also done by myself. it's even worse when someone else runs it on linux.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16539922/104937113-b244ce00-59ad-11eb-9594-3a026515575c.png)


## ğŸ”¥ Exception or Error
None

## ğŸŒ  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**

```
Angular CLI: 11.0.6
Node: 10.16.0
OS: win32 x64
```

Issues.Title: Make SwUpdate's API more coherent and useful
Issues.Body:
This feature request is for @angular/service-worker

The current API is not very user-friendly. **So far, in order to check for updates, I have to do the following:**

- Call checkForUpdate() every N minutes. When it returns, **I don't know if the check was successful and if there is an update**
- I have to subscribe to SwUpdate.available(), and I can act accordingly, for example prompt the user
- SwUpdate.available() **seems to fire only once**, I need to save (or remember) that an UpdateAvailableEvent is available (if the user clicks "No" in my "Would-you-like-to-reload-prompt". Also, SwUpdate.available() seems to be firing twice in a row from time to time, I have not been able to reproduce it consistently.
- SwUpdate.activateUpdate() also does not give my anything useful in return.

**How I would like the API to be:**
- checkForUpdate() returns Observable<UpdateAvailableEvent> if there is an update, or undefined if not. And an error if the check failed (no connection?)
- activateUpdate() returns Observable<boolean> with true if it was successful, or false if not
- available() would not be needed anymore

Does this make sense?

Cheers
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Make SwUpdate's API more coherent and useful" (#40467)

Issues.Title: Unable to override providers in submodules
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ bug report ### Affected Package @angular/core ### Is this a regression? No, I tested from Angular 4 to Angular 11, and bug was always present. ### Description `providers` array is not taken into account in submodules. For example, with following module declaration: ```typescript @NgModule({ declarations: [ Child1Component ], exports: [ Child1Component ], providers: [ {provide: MyService, useValue: {'hello': true } } ], }) export class Module1 { } @NgModule({ declarations: [ Child2Component ], exports: [ Child2Component ], providers: [ {provide: MyService, useValue: {'world': true } } ], }) export class Module2 { } @NgModule({ declarations: [ AppComponent ], imports: [ BrowserModule, Module1, Module2 ], providers: [], bootstrap: [AppComponent] }) export class AppModule { } ``` I would expect `MyService` to be: - `{'hello': true }` in `Child1Component` - `{'world': true }` in `Child2Component` But it has the same value in the 2 components. ## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-bnxcny?file=src/app/app.module.ts I expect console to display: ``` hello world ``` Instead of: ``` world world ``` ## ğŸŒ Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 11.0.7
Node: 12.19.0
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 11.0.9
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Issues.Title: Cannot determine if animation player has started
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ bug report ### Affected Package @angular/animations ### Is this a regression? No, not a regression. ### Description There is no way to determine if there is running animation at given moment after first call to `AnimationPlayer` `play` method. I am building `AnimationPlayer` in order to animate a given part of my application. Before I call `player.play()` method if I check `player.hasStarted()` it returns `false` which is ok. After first call to `player.play()` `player.hasStarted()` returns `true` when: - I check immediately after `player.play()` call - this is ok. - I check in `onDone` handler - not sure if this is ok. Player has started but it is also has ended. - I check after animation is done and I call `player.reset()` - this is not ok. I am resetting the player and I expect everything to be set to its initial value. Whatever I do `hasStarted` returns `true` after first call to `play`. ## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction Reproducing sample at this repository - https://github.com/wnvko/AngularAnimationsIssue Steps: - clone, `npm i` and then `ng serve -o`. - click on the button. - click again on the button. Observe how `hasStarted` changes. ## ğŸ”¥ Exception or Error No exception or errors are thrown. Just behavior is not correct. ## ğŸŒ Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 11.0.7
Node: 12.16.1
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 11.0.9
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Issues.Title: Building of Angular project runs out of memory after introducing strict mode
Issues.Body:
I have an Angular project. Initially it was not using strict mode because there was no strict mode. When building this non-strict variant of my Angular project, the Nodejs process running the Typescript compiler takes up to approximately 8GB of RAM.

Now Angular and typescript have come to support strict mode, so I have introduced strict mode.

I have done many changes like this:

Before strict mode:
friend: Person;

After strict mode:
friend: Person | undefined;

Now I cannot build the Angular project anymore because the Node process fails with the usual out of heap space error as approximately 30 GB has been allocated by the Node process. It also takes much, much longer time to run the build process until it finally fails.

As far as I have read, the Typescript compiler consumes much more memory when using union types which you just need to do, when using the strict mode.

My machine only has 32 GB of RAM.

Will there be something done to the Typescript compiler, so it's not so RAM hungy when using union types or I must face, that I need a machine with more than 32 GB RAM for building my Angular project?

Is there some flag which can be used, so the Nodejs process can allocate more memory than the amount of physical RAM and hereby using virtual memory in addition? If I for instance do "NODE_OPTIONS=--max_old_space_size=65536" I cannot make Nodejs to allocate more than the amount of physical RAM.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Building of Angular project runs out of memory after introducing strict mode" (#40468)

Issues.Title: Cant share code between libraries: rootDir is expected to contain all source files
Issues.Body:
# ğŸš€ feature request

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for @angular/cli or @ng-packagr/ng-packagr

### Description
When developing libraries it seems to be impossible to share code between them. E.g. two libraries may use the same interfaces. But as soon as importing something from outside of the libraries root folder (./projects/*) the build fails with error:

> rootDir is expected to contain all source files

Example: 

```
ng new my-workspace --create-application=false
cd my-workspace
ng generate library my-lib
```

Create a file `./projects/shared.ts`:

```
export interface Hello {
 world: string;
}
```

Import this file somewhere in the library, e.g. in `./projects/my-lib/src/lib/my-lib.service.ts`.

What I tried:
- Setting `rootDir` or `rootDirs` in tsconfig.json does not have any effect.
- Setting `paths` in tsconfig.json does not change the error

### Describe the solution you'd like
Any solution importing a file from outside the library (e.g. I do share TypeScript interfaces with the Node.js backend) would be great! I searched for hours finding no solution.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Cant share code between libraries: rootDir is expected to contain all source files" (#19831)

Issues.Body:
# ğŸ Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [X] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: .... Nope, don't think so. ### Description When i try to do a build with angular it throws this warning at the end of it: ``` chunk {} runtime.39e440ffc58a0c5ea137.js (runtime) 2.62 kB [entry] [rendered] chunk {1} main.f0787a89e56367a0d4ae.js (main) 111 kB [initial] [rendered] chunk {2} polyfills.45adc7f91fa71ef6f425.js (polyfills) 166 kB [initial] [rendered] chunk {3} polyfills-es5.834fe503d6f9b3377e74.js (polyfills-es5) 249 kB [initial] [rendered] chunk {4} styles.3dd4681c5b97bbeabdf5.css (styles) 569 kB [initial] [rendered] chunk {5} vendor.b4bbba3e16bf4652debe.js (vendor) 1.46 MB [initial] [rendered] chunk {6} 6.8e8c786becf994378b6c.js () 1.07 MB [rendered] chunk {7} 7.6b6ed83ee281f7c77918.js () 34.4 kB [rendered] chunk {8} 8.7cf7cb03827a25cd0afb.js () 43.1 kB [rendered] chunk {scripts} scripts.0022afdcd9fa76f58a28.js (scripts) 324 kB [entry] [rendered] Date: 2020-10-29T02:38:20.143Z - Hash: 14cc2dc96fe0ed82f9cc - Time: 52396ms WARNING in webpack-subresource-integrity: Cannot determine asset for chunk scripts, computed="undefined", available=scripts.0022afdcd9fa76f58a28.js. Please report this full error message along with your Webpack configuration at https://github.com/waysact/webpack-subresource-integrity/issues/new ``` While it seems to have to detrimental effect on the finished build, I would still like to not have a warning in my build process :sweat_smile: I've opened an issue over at the waysact/webpack-subresource-integrity: https://github.com/waysact/webpack-subresource-integrity/issues/133 Where someone took a look at it and referred me to discuss this issue with you folks furthermore. ## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/lukaskurz/sri_warning_demo All you have to do is run `make` to get the warning. ## ğŸ”¥ Exception or Error

Issues.Title: Replace deprecated TypeScript methods
Issues.Body:
TypeScript provides a set of  pure  functions for producing syntax tree nodes. Since TypeScript 4.0 these methods have been deprecated in favor of the `factory` API.

See: https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/wiki/API-Breaking-Changes#typescript-40
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Replace deprecated TypeScript methods" (#19826)

Issues.Title: "extractCss" is deprecated warning, although extractCss is not being used after updating to Angular 11
Issues.Body:
I'm getting the following warning after updating to angular 11:

```
Option "extractCss" is deprecated: Deprecated since version 11.0. No longer required to disable CSS extraction for HMR.
```

The option doesn't appear at all in the angular.json. Is there a way to disable this warning? Any idea what could be triggering it?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ""extractCss" is deprecated warning, although extractCss is not being used after updating to Angular 11" (#19819)

Issues.Title: Cant build multiple libraries in parallel: ngcc is already running
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ bug report ### Description When building multiple libraries in parallel, on a fresh project, the compiler throws an error: > ngcc is already running ## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction ``` ng new my-workspace --create-application=false cd my-workspace ng generate library my-lib1 ng generate library my-lib2 npx concurrently "npm:ng build my-lib1" "npm:ng build my-lib2" ``` _Using concurrently here, otherwise we might not see the logs/errors in console_ If we now build one app once it works: ``` ng build mylib-1 npx concurrently "npm:ng build my-lib1" "npm:ng build my-lib2" ``` If we delete node_modules and try again, the error occurs again until we build a single library: ``` rm -r node_modules npm install npx concurrently "npm:ng build my-lib1" "npm:ng build my-lib2" ``` ## ğŸŒ Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1100.5
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1100.5
@angular-devkit/core            11.0.5
@angular-devkit/schematics      11.0.5
@schematics/angular             11.0.5
@schematics/update              0.1100.5
ng-packagr                      11.0.3
rxjs                            6.6.3
typescript                      4.0.5
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Cant build multiple libraries in parallel: ngcc is already running " (#19817)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): add service-worker as optional peer dependency
Issues.Body:
The `@angular/service-worker` package is used by the browser and app-shell builders.
By adding the package as an optional peer dependency, package managers can ensure that the package is available to import.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): add service-worker as optional peer dependency" (#19820)

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>rollup/rollup</summary>

### [`v2.37.0`](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​2370)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/compare/v2.36.2...v2.37.0)

_2021-01-19_

##### Features

-   Always check modules for side-effects that only indirectly reexport a used variable ([#​3840](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3840))
-   Warn if a circular dependency would cause wrong execution order when preserving modules ([#​3840](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3840))

##### Bug Fixes

-   Allow consuming synthetic exports via modules that reexport a namespace ([#​3894](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3894))
-   Do not crash for circular default reexports ([#​3840](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3840))
-   Do not crash for circular synthetic namespaces ([#​3840](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3840))
-   Improve circular dependency execution order in certain scenarios ([#​3840](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3840))

##### Pull Requests

-   [#​3840](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3840): Improve circular dependency execution order ([@​lukastaegert](https://togithub.com/lukastaegert))
-   [#​3894](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3894): Always respect synthetic namespaces in namespace reexport ([@​lukastaegert](https://togithub.com/lukastaegert))

</details>

Issues.Title: Optimazation flag ensures very large deviations of the scss file sizes
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ bug report ### Description I think I found a bug in Angular compiler: It is about the `optimization` flag in the `angular.json` file.   As soon as I set the flag to `false`, a sample scss file with 70 lines of code has a size of 30kb. Variables are also imported in this file. Only variables and mixins are imported and no other css code. The variable file is about 400 lines in size and 5 of the 400 variables are used in the scss file in question. If I replace the variables with the values in the file and remove the import, the file falls below my warning size of 8kb.  Angular version 11.0.9 is used. If I set the optimazation flag to true, the the size of the example scss file with variable imports is also smaller than the 8kb warning size. **Sizes of the example scss file:** `optimazation` flag false: 29kb `optimazation` flag false without variables import: < 8kb `optimazation` flag true: < 8kb ## ğŸŒ Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 11.0.7
Node: 12.18.0
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 11.0.9
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, localize, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1100.7
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1100.7
@angular-devkit/core            11.0.7
@angular-devkit/schematics      11.0.7
@angular/cdk                    11.0.3
@angular/cli                    11.0.7
@schematics/angular             11.0.7
@schematics/update              0.1100.7
rxjs                            6.6.3
typescript                      4.0.5
**Anything else relevant?**

Issues.Title: build: bump @bazel/jasmine from 2.3.2 to 3.0.0
Issues.Body:
Bumps [@bazel/jasmine](https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/tree/HEAD/packages/jasmine) from 2.3.2 to 3.0.0.
Release notes

Sourced from @bazel/jasmine's releases.

3.0.0

Following our usual 6-month cadence for major releases, here is 3.0.0 just in time for your winter vacation! As usual, we've done our best to make breaking changes that improve the long-term health of the project and which are easy to adopt. Give us feedback in the #javascript channel on slack.bazel.build

ğŸ‘ğŸ» Thanks to our awesome contributors for this release! ğŸ‘ğŸ»

@mistic, @lukasholzer, @duarten, @jbedard, @mrmeku , @opelhoward , @Schibum , @mattinsler , @JiaLiPassion , @fredrikredflag , @KrauseStefan , @comius , @lovepocky , @tylerhou and @OlaviSau

To upgrade:

http_archive(
    name = "build_bazel_rules_nodejs",
    sha256 = "6142e9586162b179fdd570a55e50d1332e7d9c030efd853453438d607569721d",
    urls = ["https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/releases/download/3.0.0/rules_nodejs-3.0.0.tar.gz"],
)

and upgrade your @bazel-scoped npm packages (you'll get an error when installing 2.x version packages with rules_nodejs 3.x)

Finally, read the ğŸ“š Migration instructions from 2.x for breaking changes: https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/wiki#migrating-to-30

BREAKING CHANGES

Stricter installs

For both yarn_install and npm_install we now fail if the lockfile is out-of-date, rather than update it. This assumes you'll use the tooling to manually update the lockfile as needed.

yarn_install now passes --frozen_lockfile by default, but you can use yarn_install(frozen_lockfile = False) to go back to the old behavior.

npm_install now has an attribute npm_command that defaults to ci but you can set it to install to go back to the old behavior.

We also flipped the default for strict_visibility on these two rules. This prevents you adding a Bazel dependency on a library that isn't listed as a dependency in package.json. You can set it back to False if you need the old behavior.

--bazel_patch_module_resolver defaults to false

By default, we no longer patch the require() function, instead you should rely on the linker to make node modules resolvable at the standard location if this breaks you, the quickest fix is to flip the flag back on a nodejs_binary/nodejs_test/npm_package_bin with templated_args = ["--bazel_patch_module_resolver"], see bazelbuild/rules_nodejs#2344 as an example. Another fix is to explicitly use our runfiles helper library, see bazelbuild/rules_nodejs#2341 as an example.

karma and ts_devserver rules moved to new package @bazel/concatjs

packages/karma:package.bzl is gone, in your WORKSPACE replace

load("//packages/karma:package.bzl", "npm_bazel_karma_dependencies")

</tr></table>

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from @bazel/jasmine's changelog.

3.0.0 (2020-12-22)

For a full list for the breaking changes in 3.0.0 and other notes on migrating, see the Migrating to 3.0.0 wiki page.

Bug Fixes

  • builtin: only pass kwargs to the test, not the .update binary (#2361) (afa095b)

Code Refactoring

  • builtin: remove node_modules attribute from nodejs_binary, nodejs_test & ts_library (c2927af)

BREAKING CHANGES

  • builtin: We removed the node_modules attribute from nodejs_binary, nodejs_test, jasmine_node_test & ts_library.

If you are using the node_modules attribute, you can simply add the target specified there to the data or deps attribute of the rule instead.

For example,

nodejs_test(
    name = "test",
    data = [
        "test.js",
        "@npm//:node_modules",
    ],
    entry_point = "test.js",
)

or

ts_library(
    name = "lib",
    srcs = glob(["*.ts"]),
    tsconfig = ":tsconfig.json",
    deps = ["@npm//:node_modules"],
)

We also dropped support for filegroup based node_modules target and removed node_modules_filegroup from index.bzl.

If you are using this feature for user-managed deps, you must now a js_library target with external_npm_package set to True instead.

For example,

... (truncated)

Commits
  • c2927af refactor(builtin): remove node_modules attribute from nodejs_binary, nodejs_t...
  • 0203c06 refactor: make dependencies on --bazel_patch_module_resolver explicit
  • See full diff in compare view

Issues.Title: bug(cdk/overlay): panel 'pointer-events' can not be overridden by panelClass
Issues.Body:
#### Expected Behavior

I'd like to be able to completely disable `pointer-events` on an overlay. The `.cdk-overlay-pane` is the only element that doesn't have `pointer-events: none`, and there is the `panelClass` feature to add more styling to that so I'd assume that's the way to do it.

#### Actual Behavior

[_togglePointerEvents](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/11.1.0/src/cdk/overlay/overlay-ref.ts#L369-L372) overrides `pointer-events` in the `style` attribute 100% of the time. The [`.cdk-overlay-pane`](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/11.1.0/src/cdk/overlay/_overlay.scss#L55) already sets `pointer-events: auto` so I think `_togglePointerEvents` can set `pointer-events: none` when necessary but otherwise drop the inline one and let the css do  whatever it wants?

#### Environment

- Angular: 11
- CDK/Material: 11
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(cdk/overlay): panel 'pointer-events' can not be overridden by panelClass" (#21656)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-autocomplete): Programmatically focused input doesn't respond to input when using NVDA
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Stackblitz: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-scnfuz-tonvzm?file=src%2Fapp%2Fautocomplete-simple-example.ts

Steps to reproduce:
1. Enable NVDA
2. Open Stackblitz link in Firefox
3. Focus autocomplete input and select an option
4. Tab to the delete button on that option's newly created card
5. Press enter to delete and observe focus on autocomplete input
6. Try to enter text
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
After card is removed, input should be focused, its label should be announced, and it should accept input.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
Autocomplete input is focused but labels are not announced and it does not accept input.

#### Environment

- Angular: 11.0.3
- CDK/Material: 11.0.3
- Browser(s): Firefox
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-autocomplete): Programmatically focused input doesn't respond to input when using NVDA" (#21652)

Issues.Title: fix(material/datepicker): mark date input as touched when calendar is closed
Issues.Body:
Currently we mark the date input model as touched when it is blurred or the user types something in, however opening and closing the calendar is also an indicator that the user has interacted with it.

These changes add some logic to mark the inputs as touched when the calendar is closed as well.

Fixes #21643.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/datepicker): mark date input as touched when calendar is closed" (#21646)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-select): mat-select-color mixin does not style mat-options whereas mat-select-theme mxin does
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Include the mat-select-theme mixin to register the default theme (here dark-theme) `@include mat-select-theme($dark-theme);`
2. Include the mat-select-color mixin to override the default theme (here with the light-theme) `.light-theme { @include mat-select-color($light-theme); }`

#### Expected Behavior

When using the light theme and clicking on a mat-select, I expect the the options to be styled according to the style definitions for the light theme.


#### Actual Behavior

The options are styled according to the style definitions for the default (dark) theme. This only changes when I additionally include `@include mat-option-color($light-theme);`

Either I should have to include `@include mat-option-theme($dark-theme);` when setting up the default theme or mat-select-color should take care of the styling of the options as well. Anything else is confusing.


#### Environment

- Angular: 10.1.6
- CDK/Material: 10.2.5
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-select): mat-select-color mixin does not style mat-options whereas mat-select-theme mxin does" (#21644)

Issues.Title: feat(date-picker): How to tell whether the picker has been touched?
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

please refer: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-dfewqd?file=src/app/datepicker-disabled-example.html

how can we assess that the datepicker icon has been clicked (the popup opened) so essentially the control has been touched? (refer second datepicker in stackblitz)

#### Use Case

I want to style error state when control is invalid AND it has been touched (meaning the datepicker-popup opened already)

This currently does not work as the input in disabled and therefore it can never be touched :/.

#### Workaround

My workaround using click on the date-toggle does not work as the method _open() uses prevent-propagation.
The other option is to monkey patch `_open()`. Highly undesirable.

https://github.com/angular/components/blob/8172d066e0fe18d551d415989026e71a50c6193a/src/material/datepicker/datepicker-toggle.ts#L116

would you consider the date-control is touched when the picker-popup has opened?

>> we could add @Output or Observable for clicks on the triger button.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(date-picker): How to tell whether the picker has been touched?" (#21643)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(mat-autocomplete): problem with formControl binding in reactive forms
Issues.Body:
#### Documentation Feedback

I face the following issue when using material autocomplete version 11.0.3 together with Angular 11.0.9:
If coding the formControl property binding into the the connected input element like described on the documentation page (https://material.angular.io/components/autocomplete/overview) together with reactive forms approach, the posted object is always null.
I changed it by doing like follows:

Instead of
<input type="text" matInput [formControl]="myFormControlName" [matAutocomplete]="auto" />
I did the following:
<input type="text" matInput formControlName="myFormControlName" [matAutocomplete]="auto" />
Only the latter one works in that sense, that the object posted from the input is not null in onSubmit event.

Feel free to provide any suggestions of content or examples youâ€™d like us to include.

**Affected documentation page:** https://material.angular.io/components/autocomplete/overview
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(mat-autocomplete): problem with formControl binding in reactive forms" (#21642)

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental/mdc-chips): decouple removal from animation
Issues.Body:
Currently the MDC chips automatically trigger an animation that collapses the chip to 0x0 dimensions, but it still keeps it in the DOM unless the consumer updates their data source. This is misleading and there's no way for the consumer to see it.

These changes bring the chip in line with our current behavior where we only dispatch the remove event and then it's up to the consumer to remove the chip.

Making these changes also revealed some tests that were passing by accident and weren't actually testing the things they were supposed to, because the `animationend` event wasn't being dispatched. I've tweaked them in order to get them to work as expected.

Fixes #21561.

CARETAKER NOTE: This was previously merged and broke internal tests. Pantheon's harnesses will need to be updated to work with this change
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material-experimental/mdc-chips): decouple removal from animation" (#21636)

Issues.Title: bug(cdk): Animations fire only the first time
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: 
- Components: https://stackblitz.com/edit/ncstate-sat-popover-examples
- Harnesses: https://stackblitz.com/edit/ncstate-sat-popover-issues


Steps to reproduce:
1. Hover over the demo popover, popover opens with expected animations
2. Blur the demo, popover closes with expected animations
3. Hover over again, popover opens immediately without animations
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?

Step 3 should have opened the popover with the same animations as the first time.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?

The popover opens immediately without animations.

#### Environment

- Angular: ^11.0.0
- CDK/Material: ^11.0.0
- Browser(s): Any
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Any

Note: We have an open issue on the project regarding this issue [here](https://github.com/ncstate-sat/popover/issues/194
)

Issues.Title: fix(material/datepicker): clear tabindex from host node
Issues.Body: Similar to #21280. Removes the `tabindex` from the `mat-datepicker-toggle` host since it can caused accessibility issues. It was only there as a workaround which isn't required after #21046.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/datepicker): clear tabindex from host node" (#21633)

Issues.Title: bug(HarnessLoader): Unit tests fail when the harness loader is created in beforeEach
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

The unit tests fail when the harness loader is created in an async ```beforeEach``` and the TS target is ES2018.
[StackBlitz Demo](https://stackblitz.com/edit/harness-issue-hsdvet?file=src%2Fapp%2Fbutton-harness-example.spec.ts)

There are three solutions to this problem.
1. Move the call to ```TestbedHarnessEnvironment.loader``` to the ```it``` function ([demo](https://stackblitz.com/edit/harness-issue-zy6k6c?file=src%2Fapp%2Fbutton-harness-example.spec.ts)).
2. Use ```waitForAsync``` in the ```beforeEach``` instead of an async function ([demo](https://stackblitz.com/edit/harness-issue-ibdcju?file=src%2Fapp%2Fbutton-harness-example.spec.ts)).
3. Change the target to ES2016 ([demo](https://stackblitz.com/edit/harness-issue-anrpvn?file=src%2Fapp%2Fbutton-harness-example.spec.ts)).

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a unit test ```describe``` block that includes the harness loader.
2. Assign the harness loader in the ```beforeEach``` function.
3. Get a harness with ```await loader.getHander``` in an async ```it``` function.
 
#### Expected Behavior

I'd expect the test to pass, because it is setup as described in component harness [documentation](https://material.angular.io/guide/using-component-harnesses) and ES2018 is the generated default target.

#### Actual Behavior

```TestbedHarnessEnvironment.loader``` returns undefined in the ```beforeEach```, and the test fails with the following.

```bash
Error: Expected to be running in 'ProxyZone', but it was not found.
    at Function.ProxyZoneSpec.assertPresent (https://harness-issue-hsdvet.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/zone.js@0.11.3/dist/proxy.js:39:23)
    at Function.TaskStateZoneInterceptor.setup (https://harness-issue-hsdvet.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/@angular/cdk@11.0.4/bundles/cdk-testing-testbed.umd.js:354:42)
    at new TestbedHarnessEnvironment (https://harness-issue-hsdvet.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/@angular/cdk@11.0.4/bundles/cdk-testing-testbed.umd.js:1167:57)
    at Function.TestbedHarnessEnvironment.loader (https://harness-issue-hsdvet.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/@angular/cdk@11.0.4/bundles/cdk-testing-testbed.umd.js:1177:20)
    at UserContext.eval (https://harness-issue-hsdvet.stackblitz.io/~/src/app/button-harness-example.spec.ts:21:54)
TypeError: Cannot read property 'getHarness' of undefined
    at UserContext.eval (https://harness-issue-hsdvet.stackblitz.io/~/src/app/button-harness-example.spec.ts:24:37)
    at ZoneDelegate.invoke (https://harness-issue-hsdvet.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/zone.js@0.11.3/dist/zone.js:395:30)
    at ProxyZoneSpec.onInvoke (https://harness-issue-hsdvet.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/zone.js@0.11.3/dist/proxy.js:125:43)
    at ZoneDelegate.invoke (https://harness-issue-hsdvet.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/zone.js@0.11.3/dist/zone.js:394:56)
    at Zone.run (https://harness-issue-hsdvet.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/zone.js@0.11.3/dist/zone.js:155:47)
    at runInTestZone (https://harness-issue-hsdvet.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/zone.js@0.11.3/dist/jasmine-patch.js:203:38)
    at UserContext.eval (https://harness-issue-hsdvet.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/zone.js@0.11.3/dist/jasmine-patch.js:218:24)
    at <Jasmine>
```

#### Environment

- Angular: 11.0.9
- CDK/Material: 11.0.4
- Browser(s): Chrome 87.0.4280.141
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS 11.1
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(HarnessLoader): Unit tests fail when the harness loader is created in beforeEach" (#21632)
